concept.title: Region and Entry APIs
concept.shortdesc: Classes for working with GemFire regions and region entries.

ul.li: RegionFactory—This class creates a Region instance based on the provided configuration.

li.p:
IRegion—This class provides functions for managing regions and cached data. The Region interface implements the generic .NET IDictionary interface. In the GemFire APIs, IRegion implements IDictionary and Region inherits IRegion, giving you access to the full range of .NET
Generic collection functions. The functions for this class allow you to perform the following actions:
Retrieve information about the region, such as its parent region and region attribute objects.
Invalidate or destroy the region.
Add, update, invalidate and remove region entries.
Determine, individually or as entire sets, the region's entry keys, entry values and RegionEntry objects.

ul.li: RegionEntry—This class contains the key and value for the entry, and provides all non-distributed entry operations. The operations of this object are not distributed and do not affect statistics.

RegionShortcut—This class holds enum definitions for the most common region configurations. Start your region configuration with a shortcut setting in the region attribute, refid. Then customize further using the RegionAttributes.

RegionAttributes—This class holds all attribute values for a region and provides functions for retrieving all attribute settings. This class can only be modified by the AttributesFactory class before region creation, and the AttributesMutator class after region creation.
AttributesMutator—This class allows modification of an existing region's attributes for application plug-ins and expiration actions. Each region has an AttributesMutator instance.
